chapter.title: What is skit?
chapter.para: Skit is a command-line tool for managing database development. Its purpose is to allow database definitions to be managed using a Source Code Management system, and to provide the means to upgrade and patch databases in a similar way to that done for source code.
It provides the means to identify and examine all of the objects in a database, to identify differences between databases, and to generate and regenerate code to recreate and modify those databases.
Finally, it also provides a general-purpose mechanism for creating, manipulating and validating database objects programmatically.

The current implementation (&version;) supports only PostgreSQL but the underlying engine is designed to be database-agnostic. Adding support for other databases is intended to be relatively straightforward.
Note that skit currently deals only with database objects and not with data. If you have Meta-data to manage, it will have to be managed independently of skit.
